{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3100861,"name":"Zachary","username":"Zatack7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zatack7/{size}/175437_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-17T22:30:00.953Z","cooked":"

I am currently working on organizing and cataloging my team‚Äôs pneumatic components. Part of this process is sorting and then finding a way to store all these pneumatic cylinders (see below). Previously we kept them in a tub, but that was a complete mess, and finding the one that was actually needed would take far longer than it should have. What sort of methods do you use to organize/store your cylinders?

IMG_80514032√ó3024 2.96 MB

Also, how do you organize all of the fittings and stuff? I have a pretty good handle on that, but any inspiration will be useful. Thank you!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-11-17T22:30:54.978Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":204,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":1095.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":418110,"topic_slug":"organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners","display_username":"Zachary","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/a/6/a641c7f7d72b1d19eedac708b627a0dd203c54d9.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53819,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"ban the rev 40a breaker"},"post_url":"/t/organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners/418110/1","custom_user_title":"ban the rev 40a breaker","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3100862,"name":"Brendan Conover","username":"bcon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bcon/{size}/169080_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-17T22:31:18.538Z","cooked":"

We currently have what you had. If anyone has any ideas i would also appreciate. Giant tub of pistons is not fun to go through.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-11-17T22:31:18.538Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":294,"readers_count":293,"score":108.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":418110,"topic_slug":"organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners","display_username":"Brendan Conover","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"washed alum|frcdesign.org"},"post_url":"/t/organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners/418110/2","custom_user_title":"washed alum|frcdesign.org","reactions":[{"id":"call_me_hand","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3100865,"name":"Sam Geckler","username":"sgeckler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sgeckler/{size}/66162_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-17T22:36:56.343Z","cooked":"

We‚Äôve got the tub O‚ÄôStuff too. I guess we solved it this year by not having a pneumatic system! I was pleasantly surprised how it went.

But I‚Äôll be following this thread looking for ideas!

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-11-17T22:36:56.343Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":289,"readers_count":288,"score":62.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":418110,"topic_slug":"organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners","display_username":"Sam Geckler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21515,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners/418110/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3100868,"name":"Carlos Gross Jones","username":"CarlosGJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/carlosgj/{size}/131747_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-17T22:40:59.011Z","cooked":"

This is not specific to cylinders (and probably not super useful at this point), but I‚Äôd give the same advice as for screws: try to standardize on a few diameters and lengths, so you have less oddballs to keep track of and sort through.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-11-17T22:40:59.011Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":283,"readers_count":282,"score":76.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":418110,"topic_slug":"organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners","display_username":"Carlos Gross Jones","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16115,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mere hours of work can save you entire minutes of planning"},"post_url":"/t/organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners/418110/4","custom_user_title":"Mere hours of work can save you entire minutes of planning","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3100870,"name":"","username":"AaronUp","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aaronup/{size}/151708_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-17T22:41:23.978Z","cooked":"

We‚Äôve had a tote of cylinders, box of cylinders, bag of cylinders.

Personally I would organize by stroke, or by bore size depending on what‚Äôs easier for you. When you‚Äôre designing and need X length, you can check that specific box/bin/whatever. Maybe a <4" bin, 4-6 bin, etc.

I would also zip tie pairs of the same size cylinders together. Two or three times this year I ordered a cylinder size we already had because we didn‚Äôt find two of the same when looking the first time.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-11-17T22:42:56.116Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":276,"readers_count":275,"score":140.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":418110,"topic_slug":"organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3564,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1768 Drive Coach "},"post_url":"/t/organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners/418110/5","custom_user_title":"1768 Drive Coach ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3100880,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-17T23:11:37.912Z","cooked":"

I found a little bit of both. <5" of different bore. But longer keeping the same bore together made more sense.

I have bins that can fit up to 12" stroke, and up to 2" bore (at approx that). Above that there aren‚Äôt as many cylinders and can be stored on back of shelf behind some other bins ‚Äì or maybe into some long narrow box.

image727√ó969 168 KB

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-11-17T23:11:37.912Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":256,"readers_count":255,"score":86.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":418110,"topic_slug":"organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners","display_username":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/8/6/86049275b41b86a42942c978569c0fd03442ccde.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3564,"username":"AaronUp","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aaronup/{size}/151708_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2695,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners/418110/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3100927,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-18T02:08:50.116Z","cooked":"

Going from one bin to three or four bins will be surprisingly helpful on its own. Don‚Äôt overthink it.

We technically have five bins, sorted by stroke. Three of them cover the range that you have in the photo, One more for shorties, One more for mega.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-11-18T02:08:50.116Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":75.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":418110,"topic_slug":"organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners/418110/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3100943,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-18T03:02:58.209Z","cooked":"

We just went to 2 totes >1" in one tote and 3/4" &1" in the other tote. Then <6" are in a box and 6-8" are in another box with longer ones loose in the bottom of the totes. This has got to be better than what we had, all of them shoved in a cupboard and cardboard boxes of misc. pneumatic parts stacked on top of them lol

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-11-18T03:02:58.209Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":180,"readers_count":179,"score":71.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":418110,"topic_slug":"organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"My views are mine and mine alone"},"post_url":"/t/organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners/418110/8","custom_user_title":"My views are mine and mine alone","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3101066,"name":"Patrick Freivald","username":"pfreivald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pfreivald/{size}/177405_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-18T14:10:48.653Z","cooked":"

Tote. No room for anything else, unfortunately.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-11-18T14:10:48.653Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":138,"readers_count":137,"score":62.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":418110,"topic_slug":"organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners","display_username":"Patrick Freivald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7547,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Mentor at Large"},"post_url":"/t/organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners/418110/9","custom_user_title":"FRC Mentor at Large","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3101137,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-18T16:43:54.304Z","cooked":"

3946 built a wooden box that was about 3‚Äô long (for our longest cylinders) and about 12" wide, with some dividers to accommodate long cylinders, 12-16" stroke cylinders, 6-12" stroke cylinders, and short ones. It had garage-door style handles at either end. This never traveled - this was for our historical/prototyping cylinders. It looks like your version wouldn‚Äôt need to be as long.

For fittings, valves, and such, the usual small parts boxes with the removable bins, similar to the one at the upper right of OP‚Äôs picture. IIRC, we had one with larger bins and one as in the picture.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-11-18T16:44:50.773Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":27.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":418110,"topic_slug":"organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners","display_username":"Gus Michel II","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú "},"post_url":"/t/organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners/418110/10","custom_user_title":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3101142,"name":"Mike Marandola","username":"Mike_Marandola","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_marandola/{size}/255213_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-18T16:50:31.091Z","cooked":"

We hung a 2‚Äôx4‚Äô piece of peg board on the wall and hang our cylinders by their rear mounting holes. Harbor Freight sells some long peg board hooks that can hold a couple cylinders each. We wrap rubber bands across the rod and front threads so they don‚Äôt extend

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-11-18T16:50:31.091Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":41.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":418110,"topic_slug":"organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners","display_username":"Mike Marandola","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11375,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1983N11"},"post_url":"/t/organization-storage-of-pneumatic-cyliners/418110/11","custom_user_title":"1983N11","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3101157,"name":"Kara Bakowski","username":"Karibou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/karibou/{size}/193241_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-18T17:45:36.272Z","cooked":"

We divided into several bins roughly based on stroke and diameter - something akin to ‚Äúshort and skinny, long and skinny, large‚Äù (with ‚Äúlarge‚Äù being anything more than about a 1.5in bore, and ‚Äúshort‚Äù being maybe a 5in total body length or shorter).

But really, the most helpful thing was putting a piece of masking tape on the side and writing the bore and stroke, so you don‚Äôt have to measure while you search and don‚Äôt have to hold your breath and hope that it‚Äôll be the right length when you pull the rod out.
